page.title: 04Health, Casualty, Maternity
page.content: The Casualty unit treats up to 120 people a day. The most common casualties are falls, sprains, 'foreign' bodies and cuts. The average operation lasts 1/2 hour. On average 30 operations are performed each day. the most common operation is the removal of children,s tonsils. There are no rare operations as these are sent to better equipped hospitals. In Maternity 20-30 babies are born during a week. Two or Three babies are put in an incubator or born with an illness. Some are put in incubators because they are premature or look jaundiced.
